sections.text: SEQUESTRATIONArt. 3571. Grounds for sequestrationWhen one claims the ownership or right to possession of property, or a mortgage, security interest, lien, or privilege thereon, he may have the property seized under a writ of sequestration, if it is within the power of the defendant to conceal, dispose of, or waste the property or the revenues therefrom, or remove the property from the parish, during the pendency of the action.Acts 1989, No. 137, ยง18, eff. Sept. 1, 1989.
